p: Several studies demonstrated host factors associated with the outbreaks in case-control analysis, that were identified as: age [ 29], sex [ 16], cognitive impairment [ 29], nutritional status [ 27], comorbidities [ 23, 24], use of an indwelling device [ 15, 17], and dependence level [ 31]. Although not the result of the case-control analysis, the study by Spires et al. [ 50] reported that all cases of RSV and HMPV were dependent dementia patients, implicating that dependence was an important factor.
